content: Hedgehogs have a unique way of protecting themselves from predators. When they feel threatened, they can roll into a tight ball, with their spines pointing outwards. This is called "hedgehogging." The spines are sharp and can deter predators from attacking them. Additionally, some species of hedgehogs can also emit a strong odor to ward off predators. Overall, hedgehogs have evolved several adaptations to protect themselves in their natural habitat.
